question.body: What holds the bladder in place?

multiple_choice.choice: the bladder is free to move

response.feedback: Incorrect. This would probably put too much mechanical stress on the ureters.
Incorrect. Kidneys are cushioned by adipose tissue but not the bladder.
Correct. The urinary bladder is located in the pelvic cavity, just posterior to the pubic symphysis and is held in place by peritoneal folds.
Incorrect. Since there are large amounts of blood vessels in the abdomen, it is not a good idea for organs to move around.

part.hint: Choices can be narrowed by knowing how urine travels to the bladder and knowing if your own bladder can move or not.
